slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचमय्यासक्तमना: पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रय: ।असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: The Lord said: "O son of Pritha, listen attentively, for I will tell you how you will know Me completely, without doubt, by engaging your mind in Yoga, being devoted to Me."

slokas: ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषत: ।यज्ज्ञात्वा नेह भूयोऽन्यज्ज्ञातव्यमवशिष्यते ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: "I will impart to you this knowledge, with wisdom in its entirety, which, having known, there is nothing else left to be known here."

slokas: मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये ।यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्चिन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वत: ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: "Out of thousands of human beings, only a few strive for perfection. And even among those who strive, very few know Me truly."

slokas: भूमिरापोऽनलो वायु: खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च ।अहङ्कार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: "Earth, water, fire, air, ether, mind, intellect, and ego - these are My eightfold separated material nature."

slokas: अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम् ।जीवभूतां महाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत् ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: "Know that besides this, O mighty-armed one, there is another, superior nature of Mine, the living one, by which this entire universe is sustained."

slokas: एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय ।अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगत: प्रभव: प्रलयस्तथा ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: "Know that all beings have these as origins. I am the origin and dissolution of the entire universe."

slokas: मत्त: परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय ।मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: "There is nothing superior to Me, O Dhananjaya. Everything in this universe is strung together in Me, like gems strung on a thread."

slokas: रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययो: ।प्रणव: सर्ववेदेषु शब्द: खे पौरुषं नृषु ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: "I am the taste in water, O Kunti's son, the radiance in the sun and moon, the syllable Om in all the Vedas, the sound in space, manliness in men."

slokas: पुण्यो गन्ध: पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ ।जीवनं सर्वभूतेषु तपश्चास्मि तपस्विषु ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: "I am the pleasant fragrance in the earth, the brilliance in fire, life in all beings, and austerity in the ascetics."

slokas: बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम् ।बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: “Know Me, O Partha, as the eternal seed of all beings. I am the intellect of the intelligent, the brilliance of the brilliant."

slokas: बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम् ।धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: "I am strength in the strong, free from desire and attachment. Among beings, I am desire free from conflict with Dharma, O best of the Bharatas."

slokas: ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये ।मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि न त्वहं तेषु ते मयि ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: "Know that the sattvic, rajasic, and tamasic qualities are all from Me, but I am not in them, they are in Me.”

slokas: त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभि: सर्वमिदं जगत् ।मोहितं नाभिजानाति मामेभ्य: परमव्ययम् ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: "This entire universe is deluded by these three modes of material nature, and therefore does not know Me, the imperishable, beyond them."

slokas: दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया ।मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: "This divine, material nature of Mine, consisting of the three modes, is very difficult to overcome. Those who surrender to Me alone cross over this illusion.”

slokas: न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढा: प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमा: ।माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिता: ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: “The wicked, the deluded, and the lowest of mankind do not surrender to Me. Their knowledge is stolen away by illusion, and they embrace the demonic nature."

slokas: चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जना: सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन ।आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: "O best of the Bharatas, four kinds of people worship me: the distressed, the inquisitive, the seeker of wealth, and the wise."

slokas: तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्यते ।प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रिय: ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: "Among them, the wise man who is always united with Me, devoted to Me with single-minded devotion, is most dear to Me, and I am also most dear to him."

slokas: उदारा: सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम् ।आस्थित: स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम् ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: "All these are noble, but the wise one is My own self. Having attained Me, he who is united with Me attains the highest goal."

slokas: बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यते ।वासुदेव: सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभ: ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: “After many births, the wise man comes to Me, realizing, “Vasudeva is everything,” This great soul is very difficult to find.”

slokas: कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञाना: प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्यदेवता: ।तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियता: स्वया ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: “Those whose knowledge is stolen away by various desires, worship other deities, following specific rules, under the influence of their own nature."

slokas: यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्त: श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति ।तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विदधाम्यहम् ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: "Whatever form a devotee desires to worship Me with faith, I make his faith in that form unshakable."

slokas: स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्याराधनमीहते ।लभते च तत: कामान्मयैव विहितान्हि तान् ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: "United with that faith, he engages in that worship and obtains the desires granted by Me, for it is I who ordain those desires."

slokas: अन्तवत्तु फलं तेषां तद्भ‍वत्यल्पमेधसाम् ।देवान्देवयजो यान्ति मद्भ‍क्ता यान्ति मामपि ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: “The fruits of their actions are limited, for they are of limited intelligence. Those who worship the gods go to the gods, but My devotees come to Me.”

slokas: अव्यक्तं व्यक्तिमापन्नं मन्यन्ते मामबुद्धय: ।परं भावमजानन्तो ममाव्ययमनुत्तमम् ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: "The ignorant think of Me as unmanifest, having become manifest. Not knowing My supreme, eternal, and unsurpassed nature."

slokas: नाहं प्रकाश: सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृत: ।मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम् ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_translated: "I am not the illumination of all beings, being covered by My Yogamaya. This deluded world does not know Me, the unborn, the imperishable."

slokas: वेदाहं समतीतानि वर्तमानानि चार्जुन ।भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_translated: "Arjuna, I know all past, present, and future beings, but no one knows Me."

slokas: इच्छाद्वेषसमुत्थेन द्वन्द्वमोहेन भारत ।सर्वभूतानि सम्मोहं सर्गे यान्ति परन्तप ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_translated: “O descendant of Bharata, all beings are deluded by the illusion of duality, which arises from desire and aversion, and they enter into material existence."

slokas: येषां त्वन्तगतं पापं जनानां पुण्यकर्मणाम् ।ते द्वन्द्वमोहनिर्मुक्ता भजन्ते मां दृढव्रता: ॥ २८ ॥
slokas_translated: "But those whose sins are gone, who are pure in heart, who are freed from the delusion of duality, and who are steadfast in their devotion, they worship Me."

slokas: जरामरणमोक्षाय मामाश्रित्य यतन्ति ये ।ते ब्रह्म तद्विदु: कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम् ॥ २९ ॥
slokas_translated: "Those who seek liberation from old age and death, who strive for Me as their refuge, they know Brahman completely, both the inner Self and all actions."

slokas: साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदु: ।प्रयाणकालेऽपि च मां ते विदुर्युक्तचेतस: ॥ ३० ॥
slokas_translated: "Those who know Me as the Supreme Lord, the inner controller, the presiding deity, and the object of sacrifice, they know Me at the time of departure with a controlled mind."
